content.text: AJAX (Asynchronous JavaScript and XML) is a technique used in web development to send and receive data asynchronously between the client and server without reloading the entire page.
Although the name suggests that XML is involved, AJAX can actually be used with any data format, including JSON, HTML, and plain text.

content.question: What is the difference between synchronous and asynchronous requests?
options: Synchronous requests block the thread until the response is received, while asynchronous requests allow the thread to continue running while waiting for the response.
Synchronous requests are faster than asynchronous requests.
Asynchronous requests are used for GET requests, while synchronous requests are used for POST requests.
Synchronous requests are used for small data transfers, while asynchronous requests are used for large data transfers.
